page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: THE AREA COVERED BY OUR SURVEY IS VERY HILLY AND INCLUDES TWO VILLAGES:BLEWBURY AND PART OF ASTON TIRROLD.A MAJOR ROAD THE A417,LONDON TO WANTAGE,CROSSES FROM RIGHT TO LEFT AT THE TOP OF THE BLOCK AND PASSES THROUGH BLEWBURY. OUTSIDE THE VILLAGE OF BLEWBURY LAND USE IS MOSTLY AGRICULTURAL WITH SMALL PATCHES OF WOODLAND HERE AND THERE. ON THE LOWER LAND,THERE IS MIXED FARMING,WITH PASTORAL LAND USED FOR GRAZING CATTLE,PIGS AND SHEEP. THE ARABLE LAND IS MAINLY USED FOR CEREALS GROWING.ON THE DOWNS,THE SHORT DOWNLAND TURF,WITH GORSE BUSHES AND SOME WOODS IS USED FOR SHEEP GRAZING,HORSE TRAINING AND RECREATION. ASTON UPTHORPE:A STRIP OF LAND BELONGING TO THAT PARISH RUNS BETWEEN ASTON TIRROLD AND BLEWBURY LAND.
